Posts.EditableText: Hi, I completely new to this.  Ive read the tutorial and am really excited about the possibilities and have started designing a game.  I want to have a purse with coins of different denomination in it, that I can add to or take from.  I'm sure many of you have done this.  Would love to hear how.  Many thanks.

Posts.EditableText:
Easiest way is to simply create a number of Squiffy attributes. Each attribute represents a coin of a different denomination. 

You can then add or subtract coins at will, by modifying the attribute up or down. 

With a bit of javascript you could also ad up the total value of all the coins too.

[[Room1]]
@inc QUARTERS 2
@inc DIMES 2
@inc NICKELS 2
@inc PENNIES 2
@inc CENTS 82

[[Room1]]:
**Your Room**<br>
You're in your room. You have a [purse].

[purse]:
The purse contains {QUARTERS} [quarters], {DIMES} dimes, {NICKELS} nickels, and {PENNIES} pennies, for a total of {CENTS} cents.

[quarters]:
Do you want to [drop](drop quarter) a quarter?

[drop quarter]:
@dec QUARTERS
@dec CENTS 25
Ok, you dropped one quarter.

[[Continue...]](Room1)

Posts.EditableText: That's a good working example. What you'll need to do next OP is develop it further, including some conditional logic so you can't spend money you don't have. That's where things might get a bit tricky, but you can probably just about handle it using Squiffy markdown without having to resort to Javascript.
